name: Game Changer (Zombee0804)
description:
Game Changer is a two-person puzzle game in which you rotate the environment in order to guide your player to the exit, avoiding obstacles along the way. However, each time you press a key, its control will change to another key on the keyboard. With both players on the same keyboard, you must reach over your opponent's hands to reach your keys, whilst also trying to block them from reaching theirs. And remember, you don't need to press your own keys.

A three-person team created this game for a final college project. Currently, the game is in its first version so there is likely a few bugs. Please leave bug reports in the comments.

The game is made to be played as a standalone and has not been extensively tested/fixed for the browser version. Windows standalone recommended.

Known Bugs:
  1. Input keys can be pressed during the countdown
  2. Occasionally when rotating the level, there will be a visual stutter
  3. After clicking play on the menu, the selection music stutters
  4. The level countdown is inconsistent in terms of speed
  5. Pressing space on the menu/selection screen causes some strange issues
